results.content: Watching how things are done and commentary on source code are very important for me as I am a visual learner. I am a deaf person. The auto generated captions are not too bad :)

results.content:
Although the course does cover basics and important things, the way it is made up is not ideal. It does not take you step by step through the code, but rather shows you the finished code and few snippets. Also I am left with a lot of questions (as a total beginner) that I believe should have been covered in the tutorial had it been covered in more step by step detail. 
Also the music in the background is redundant.

It does not take you step by step through the code, but rather shows you the finished code and few snippets. Also the music in the background is redundant.

results.content:
What I liked: The course teaches a number of useful techniques for extracting information from the Google Maps API and how to add your own markers/drawings to a map. 

What could be improved: The instruction was delivered in a computer generated voice. You do not realize how much inflection/emphasis adds to delivery until it is gone. The logical flow of the course was not necessarily bad, but the content flow follows solutions that have already been completed. While it would have taken more time to go through the process of crafting the solutions, I would have learned more from going through the process. The downloadable content was not placed in .zip files, having the whole project section laid out. Rather, it was in a single .txt file with the css/html/js files commented in their respective sections.

Overall: The delivery of information is a stumbling block, but I feel like the course content is solid.

results.content:
Gratulálok Miklós! Nagyon jól sikerült , lényegretörő lecke volt. A sok forrás anyag külön sokat ér, segít visszakeresni a lényeges információkat.
Várom további kurzusait. Ami különösen érdekelne a Firebase és a gMap kapcsolata, realtime működése. Szintén  érdekes téma a KML file készítése, beépítése. Még egyszer sok sikert Önnek. Üdv. Fodor László (fodorl@me.com)
